premise: The graph shows two lines: a straight line A representing the U-I graph of a power source and a curve B representing the U-I graph of a small light bulb.
conclusion: The intersection point of line A and curve B indicates the operating point of the circuit.

premise: The intersection point of line A and curve B is at \\( I = 2 \, \text{A} \\) and \\( U = 2 \, \text{V} \\).
conclusion: The operating point of the circuit is at \\( I = 2 \, \text{A} \\) and \\( U = 2 \, \text{V} \\).

premise: The output power of the power source is calculated as \\( P_{\text{out}} = U \times I \\).
The EMF of the power source is the y-intercept of line A, which is \\( 3 \, \text{V} \\).
conclusion: The EMF of the power source is \\( 3 \, \text{V} \\).

premise: The total power of the power source is calculated as \\( P_{\text{total}} = \text{EMF} \times I \\).
